Container.Name: Mopidy3
Container.Overview:
Mopidy is an extensible music server written in Python. Mopidy plays music from local disk, Spotify, SoundCloud, Google Play Music, and more. You edit the playlist from any phone, tablet, or computer using a range of MPD and web clients.
This is Mopidy3 for unraid with support for snapcast and multiple instances with automatic snapcast stream management.
- set up the docker - set up volume mount to /mnt/user/appdata/mopidy/ >> /config/ - set up volume mount for tmp/snapfifo if you use snapcast /mnt/user/appdata/mopidy/tmp/ >> /tmp - set up volume mount for your local media - add an MPD and HTTP TCP port for each additional instance you want
A configuration has been autogenerated with basic settings. The template for it can be found in the container in `/home/templates`.
Do NOT modify the part of the audio output setting that says `/tmp/snapfifo`. This is automatically replaced for each instance generated.
To configure the instance and snapcast settings, copy the template to your config folder and modify it. `cp /home/templates/server.json /config/`.

Config.Name: Share
Config.Description: The location where DB files are stored. If you don't add this, your docker image will bloat.

Config.Name: MPD Port
Config.Description: This should match whats in your config

Config.Name: HTTP Port
Config.Description: The default port for TCP Streams in Snapcast

Config.Name: Supervisord Port
Config.Description: Where the supervisord web UI lives

Config.Name: Templates Dir
